Dear Ms. Aufdemberge:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
July 29, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. If I am not available and you need to speak to someone immediately, please
contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Three references were not obtained for three of thirteen new
staff prior to employment.
R 400.4147 Dental Care.
(3) Reexamination shall be provided at least every 14
months unless greater frequency is indicated.
One of three youth did not have an annual dental exam.
2.) The facility is in compliance will all ISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance with all MDDHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The child status section of the UTP is to reflect the child’s status during the time
frame designated on the report.
V. Consultation
No consultation was requested or required during this inspection.
1

VI. EVALUATION OF INSPECTION PERIOD
The facility had a total of 49 restraints during this reporting period compared to 25 in
the last period. The reason for the increase was attributed to one specific youth who
required 21 restraints and another requiring 5.
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no violations involving corporal punishment during this licensing period.
The facility had no violations relative to the special investigations conducted. At the
last inspection, there was one DHHS contract citation involving MISACWIS restraint
reporting.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
